trans-unit.source: Supported Queries, Filters, and Paging Options
trans-unit.target: Supported Queries, Filters, and Paging Options

trans-unit.source: Supported Queries, Filters, and Paging Options in Azure AD Graph API
trans-unit.target: Supported Queries, Filters, and Paging Options in Azure AD Graph API

trans-unit.source: This topic lists query options, filters, and paging operations that can be used with the Azure AD Graph.
trans-unit.target: This topic lists query options, filters, and paging operations that can be used with the Azure AD Graph.

trans-unit.source: For examples of common queries in the Graph, see <link xlink:href="3f3199df-de7d-49ff-92d2-58c8e3e9c9e9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure AD Graph Common Queries</link>.
trans-unit.target: For examples of common queries in the Graph, see <link xlink:href="3f3199df-de7d-49ff-92d2-58c8e3e9c9e9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Azure AD Graph Common Queries</link>.

trans-unit.source: Addressing
trans-unit.target: Addressing

trans-unit.source: The queries below all address the tenant using a domain name.
trans-unit.target: The queries below all address the tenant using a domain name.

trans-unit.source: You can replace <codeEntityReference>contoso.com</codeEntityReference> with one of your tenant’s registered domain names to successfully run the queries against your subscription.
trans-unit.target: You can replace <codeEntityReference>contoso.com</codeEntityReference> with one of your tenant’s registered domain names to successfully run the queries against your subscription.

trans-unit.source: For information about other ways of addressing the tenant, see <link xlink:href="5b0f3e3d-f96e-4b5b-864d-fc7c6b185097" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Addressing Aliases</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about other ways of addressing the tenant, see <link xlink:href="5b0f3e3d-f96e-4b5b-864d-fc7c6b185097" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Addressing Aliases</link>.

trans-unit.source: Supported Query Options
trans-unit.target: Supported Query Options

trans-unit.source: The Graph supports the following query options: <embeddedLabel>$filter</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>$orderby</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>$expand</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>$top</embeddedLabel>, and <embeddedLabel>$format</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The Graph supports the following query options: <embeddedLabel>$filter</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>$orderby</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>$expand</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>$top</embeddedLabel>, and <embeddedLabel>$format</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The following query options are not currently supported: <embeddedLabel>$count</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>$inlinecount</embeddedLabel>, and <embeddedLabel>$skip</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The following query options are not currently supported: <embeddedLabel>$count</embeddedLabel>, <embeddedLabel>$inlinecount</embeddedLabel>, and <embeddedLabel>$skip</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: $filter
trans-unit.target: $filter

trans-unit.source: The following general restrictions apply to queries that contain a filter:
trans-unit.target: The following general restrictions apply to queries that contain a filter:

trans-unit.source: $filter cannot be combined with $orderby expressions.
trans-unit.target: $filter cannot be combined with $orderby expressions.

trans-unit.source: Filtering is not supported for queries on <link xlink:href="a866c097-7c4c-4328-9eda-6fa81a62b12a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Role</link> or <link xlink:href="78a94030-b8af-4e69-b4b3-cb577a916ab2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">SubscribedSku</link> directory objects.
trans-unit.target: Filtering is not supported for queries on <link xlink:href="a866c097-7c4c-4328-9eda-6fa81a62b12a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Role</link> or <link xlink:href="78a94030-b8af-4e69-b4b3-cb577a916ab2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">SubscribedSku</link> directory objects.

trans-unit.source: Not all properties of supported directory objects can be used in a filter expression.
trans-unit.target: Not all properties of supported directory objects can be used in a filter expression.

trans-unit.source: For information about filterable properties of supported types, see <link xlink:href="6b0f847b-831b-474d-9189-78af89ee7977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">User</link>, <link xlink:href="8c5aa9b2-7396-43d8-999a-df2e98b2a56f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Group</link>, and <link xlink:href="6844d2d7-02d5-41eb-8f46-3e3b19d801f6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Contact</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about filterable properties of supported types, see <link xlink:href="6b0f847b-831b-474d-9189-78af89ee7977" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">User</link>, <link xlink:href="8c5aa9b2-7396-43d8-999a-df2e98b2a56f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Group</link>, and <link xlink:href="6844d2d7-02d5-41eb-8f46-3e3b19d801f6" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Contact</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following restrictions apply to filter expressions:
trans-unit.target: The following restrictions apply to filter expressions:

trans-unit.source: Logical operators: <languageKeyword>and</languageKeyword> is supported and <languageKeyword>or</languageKeyword> is supported.
trans-unit.target: Logical operators: <languageKeyword>and</languageKeyword> is supported and <languageKeyword>or</languageKeyword> is supported.

trans-unit.source: For example: <parameterReference>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users?api-version=2013-11-08%%amp;amp;$filter=accountEnabled eq true and (userPrincipalName eq 'jonlawr@contoso.com' or mail eq 'jonlawr@contoso.com')</parameterReference>
trans-unit.target: For example: <parameterReference>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users?api-version=2013-11-08%%amp;amp;$filter=accountEnabled eq true and (userPrincipalName eq 'jonlawr@contoso.com' or mail eq 'jonlawr@contoso.com')</parameterReference>

trans-unit.source: Comparison operators: <languageKeyword>eq</languageKeyword> (equal to), <languageKeyword>ge</languageKeyword> (greater than or equal to), and <languageKeyword>le</languageKeyword> (less than or equal to) are supported.
trans-unit.target: Comparison operators: <languageKeyword>eq</languageKeyword> (equal to), <languageKeyword>ge</languageKeyword> (greater than or equal to), and <languageKeyword>le</languageKeyword> (less than or equal to) are supported.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Startswith</embeddedLabel> is supported.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Startswith</embeddedLabel> is supported.

trans-unit.source: For example: <parameterReference>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users?api-version=2013-11-08%%amp;amp;$filter=startswith(displayName,'Mary')</parameterReference>
trans-unit.target: For example: <parameterReference>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users?api-version=2013-11-08%%amp;amp;$filter=startswith(displayName,'Mary')</parameterReference>

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Any</embeddedLabel> is supported when querying multi-valued properties.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Any</embeddedLabel> is supported when querying multi-valued properties.

trans-unit.source: For example: <parameterReference>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users?api-version=2013-11-08%%amp;amp;$filter=userPrincipalName eq 'Mary@Contoso.com' or proxyAddresses/any(c:c eq 'smtp:Mary@Contoso.com')</parameterReference>
trans-unit.target: For example: <parameterReference>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users?api-version=2013-11-08%%amp;amp;$filter=userPrincipalName eq 'Mary@Contoso.com' or proxyAddresses/any(c:c eq 'smtp:Mary@Contoso.com')</parameterReference>

trans-unit.source: Arithmetic operators: not supported.
trans-unit.target: Arithmetic operators: not supported.

trans-unit.source: Functions: not supported.
trans-unit.target: Functions: not supported.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>null</languageKeyword> values are not supported as an operand in filter expressions.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>null</languageKeyword> values are not supported as an operand in filter expressions.

trans-unit.source: For example, you cannot specify a <languageKeyword>null</languageKeyword> value to filter for unset properties.
trans-unit.target: For example, you cannot specify a <languageKeyword>null</languageKeyword> value to filter for unset properties.

trans-unit.source: $orderby
trans-unit.target: $orderby

trans-unit.source: $orderby will sort the returned objects by the specified parameter.
trans-unit.target: $orderby will sort the returned objects by the specified parameter.

trans-unit.source: Example requests using the $orderby option:
trans-unit.target: Example requests using the $orderby option:

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users?$orderby=displayName&api-version=2013-11-08
trans-unit.target: https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users?$orderby=displayName&api-version=2013-11-08

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of users ordered by their display name.
trans-unit.target: Returns a list of users ordered by their display name.

trans-unit.source: https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users?$orderby=displayName&$top=50&api-version=2013-11-08
trans-unit.target: https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users?$orderby=displayName&$top=50&api-version=2013-11-08

trans-unit.source: Returns a list of the first 50 users ordered by their display name.
trans-unit.target: Returns a list of the first 50 users ordered by their display name.

trans-unit.source: The following restrictions apply to $orderby expressions:
trans-unit.target: The following restrictions apply to $orderby expressions:

trans-unit.source: Two sort orders are currently supported: <embeddedLabel>DisplayName</embeddedLabel> for User and Group objects, and <embeddedLabel>UserPrincipalName</embeddedLabel> for User objects.
trans-unit.target: Two sort orders are currently supported: <embeddedLabel>DisplayName</embeddedLabel> for User and Group objects, and <embeddedLabel>UserPrincipalName</embeddedLabel> for User objects.

trans-unit.source: The default sort order for Users is by <embeddedLabel>UserPrincipalName</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The default sort order for Users is by <embeddedLabel>UserPrincipalName</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: $orderby cannot be combined with $filter expressions.
trans-unit.target: $orderby cannot be combined with $filter expressions.

trans-unit.source: $expand
trans-unit.target: $expand

trans-unit.source: $expand will return an object and its linked objects.
trans-unit.target: $expand will return an object and its linked objects.

trans-unit.source: Example requests using the $expand option:
trans-unit.target: Example requests using the $expand option:

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/groups/1747ad35-dd4c-4115-8604-09b54f89277d?$expand=members&api-version=2013-11-08
trans-unit.target: https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/groups/1747ad35-dd4c-4115-8604-09b54f89277d?$expand=members&api-version=2013-11-08

trans-unit.source: Returns both the group object as well as its members.
trans-unit.target: Returns both the group object as well as its members.

trans-unit.source: https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users/derek@contoso.com?$expand=directReports&api-version=2013-11-08
trans-unit.target: https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users/derek@contoso.com?$expand=directReports&api-version=2013-11-08

trans-unit.source: Returns both the user object as well as its direct reports.
trans-unit.target: Returns both the user object as well as its direct reports.

trans-unit.source: https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users/adam@contoso.com?$expand=manager&api-version=2013-11-08
trans-unit.target: https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users/adam@contoso.com?$expand=manager&api-version=2013-11-08

trans-unit.source: Returns both the user object as well as its manager.
trans-unit.target: Returns both the user object as well as its manager.

trans-unit.source: The following restrictions apply to $expand expressions:
trans-unit.target: The following restrictions apply to $expand expressions:

trans-unit.source: The maximum number of returned objects for a request is 20.
trans-unit.target: The maximum number of returned objects for a request is 20.

trans-unit.source: $top
trans-unit.target: $top

trans-unit.source: $top is not supported for queries on <link xlink:href="a866c097-7c4c-4328-9eda-6fa81a62b12a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Role</link> or <link xlink:href="78a94030-b8af-4e69-b4b3-cb577a916ab2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">SubscribedSku</link> directory objects.
trans-unit.target: $top is not supported for queries on <link xlink:href="a866c097-7c4c-4328-9eda-6fa81a62b12a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Role</link> or <link xlink:href="78a94030-b8af-4e69-b4b3-cb577a916ab2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">SubscribedSku</link> directory objects.

trans-unit.source: Paging Support
trans-unit.target: Paging Support

trans-unit.source: You can page forward and backward in the Graph.
trans-unit.target: You can page forward and backward in the Graph.

trans-unit.source: A response that contains paged results will include a skip token (odata.nextLink) that allows you to get the next page of results.
trans-unit.target: A response that contains paged results will include a skip token (odata.nextLink) that allows you to get the next page of results.

trans-unit.source: This skip token can be combined with a <embeddedLabel>previous-page=true</embeddedLabel> query argument to page backwards.
trans-unit.target: This skip token can be combined with a <embeddedLabel>previous-page=true</embeddedLabel> query argument to page backwards.

trans-unit.source: The follow example request demonstrates paging forward:
trans-unit.target: The follow example request demonstrates paging forward:

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users?$top=5&api-version=2013-11-08&$skiptoken=X'4453707402.....0000'
trans-unit.target: https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users?$top=5&api-version=2013-11-08&$skiptoken=X'4453707402.....0000'

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>$skiptoken</embeddedLabel> parameter from the previous response is included, and allows you to get the next page of results.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>$skiptoken</embeddedLabel> parameter from the previous response is included, and allows you to get the next page of results.

trans-unit.source: The following example request demonstrates paging backward:
trans-unit.target: The following example request demonstrates paging backward:

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users?$top=5&api-version=2013-11-08&$skiptoken=X'4453707.....00000'&previous-page=true
trans-unit.target: https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users?$top=5&api-version=2013-11-08&$skiptoken=X'4453707.....00000'&previous-page=true

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>$skiptoken</embeddedLabel> parameter from the previous response is included.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>$skiptoken</embeddedLabel> parameter from the previous response is included.

trans-unit.source: When this is combined with the <embeddedLabel>&previous-page=true</embeddedLabel> parameter, the previous page of results will be retrieved.
trans-unit.target: When this is combined with the <embeddedLabel>&previous-page=true</embeddedLabel> parameter, the previous page of results will be retrieved.

trans-unit.source: The following steps demonstrate the request/response flow to page forward and backward:
trans-unit.target: The following steps demonstrate the request/response flow to page forward and backward:

trans-unit.source: A request is made to get a list of the first 10 users out of 15.
trans-unit.target: A request is made to get a list of the first 10 users out of 15.

trans-unit.source: The response contains a skip token to indicate the final page of 10 users.
trans-unit.target: The response contains a skip token to indicate the final page of 10 users.

trans-unit.source: To get the final 5 users, another request is made that contains the skip token returned from the previous response.
trans-unit.target: To get the final 5 users, another request is made that contains the skip token returned from the previous response.

trans-unit.source: To page backward, a request is made using the skip token returned in step 1 and the parameter <embeddedLabel>&previous-page=true</embeddedLabel> is added to the request.
trans-unit.target: To page backward, a request is made using the skip token returned in step 1 and the parameter <embeddedLabel>&previous-page=true</embeddedLabel> is added to the request.

trans-unit.source: The response contains the previous (first) page of 10 users.
trans-unit.target: The response contains the previous (first) page of 10 users.

trans-unit.source: In a different scenario where more pages are left, a new skip token would be returned.
trans-unit.target: In a different scenario where more pages are left, a new skip token would be returned.

trans-unit.source: This new skip token can be added to the request along with <embeddedLabel>&previous-page=true</embeddedLabel> to page backward again.
trans-unit.target: This new skip token can be added to the request along with <embeddedLabel>&previous-page=true</embeddedLabel> to page backward again.

trans-unit.source: The following restrictions apply to paged requests:
trans-unit.target: The following restrictions apply to paged requests:

trans-unit.source: The default page size is 100.
trans-unit.target: The default page size is 100.

trans-unit.source: The maximum page size is 999.
trans-unit.target: The maximum page size is 999.

trans-unit.source: Queries against roles do not support paging.
trans-unit.target: Queries against roles do not support paging.

trans-unit.source: This includes reading role objects themselves as well as role members.
trans-unit.target: This includes reading role objects themselves as well as role members.

trans-unit.source: Resource listing, such as a blanket <embeddedLabel>/users</embeddedLabel> queries do support paging.
trans-unit.target: Resource listing, such as a blanket <embeddedLabel>/users</embeddedLabel> queries do support paging.

trans-unit.source: For example: <parameterReference>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users?api-version=2013-11-08</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: For example: <parameterReference>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users?api-version=2013-11-08</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: However, across all types when a filter is applied, paging is not supported and only the first page of results is returned.
trans-unit.target: However, across all types when a filter is applied, paging is not supported and only the first page of results is returned.

trans-unit.source: Paging is not supported for link searches, such as for querying group members.
trans-unit.target: Paging is not supported for link searches, such as for querying group members.

trans-unit.source: For example: <parameterReference>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/groups/3f575eef-bb04-44a5-a9af-eee9f547e3f9/$links/members?api-version=2013-11-08</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: For example: <parameterReference>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/groups/3f575eef-bb04-44a5-a9af-eee9f547e3f9/$links/members?api-version=2013-11-08</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: Sort Order
trans-unit.target: Sort Order

trans-unit.source: The result set of a query for all users is ordered by the <system>UserPrincipalName</system> property.
trans-unit.target: The result set of a query for all users is ordered by the <system>UserPrincipalName</system> property.

trans-unit.source: For example: <parameterReference>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users?api-version=2013-11-08</parameterReference>.
trans-unit.target: For example: <parameterReference>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/users?api-version=2013-11-08</parameterReference>.

trans-unit.source: The result set of a query for all other top-level resources, such as Groups, Contacts, etc. is ordered by the <system>objectId</system> property.
trans-unit.target: The result set of a query for all other top-level resources, such as Groups, Contacts, etc. is ordered by the <system>objectId</system> property.

trans-unit.source: For example: <parameterReference>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/groups?api-version=2013-11-08</parameterReference>
trans-unit.target: For example: <parameterReference>https://graph.windows.net/contoso.com/groups?api-version=2013-11-08</parameterReference>

trans-unit.source: The order of the results of queries other than for top-level resources is indeterminate.
trans-unit.target: The order of the results of queries other than for top-level resources is indeterminate.
